title: [Large-Scale] Gamification Learning Design: Social and Organizational Competency Development Course for Strengthening Managerial Leadership (Citizen Awareness and Institutional Foundations)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device proficiency, organizational management experience, understanding of socio-organizational relationships and systems, foundational awareness of civic rights and responsibilities
context.additional_context: Building a gamification environment based on real-world work cases (reflecting organizational culture, leadership styles, civic consciousness, and institutional frameworks), and measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessments (evaluating team collaboration, problem-solving, decision-making, and social impact).

learning_goals: With ≥85% participation, learners perform conflict management and decision-making simulations on a gamification platform to enhance leadership competencies and civic consciousness
By Week 4, learners can derive ≥3 context-based design strategies for situational problem-solving (organizational culture, resource allocation, stakeholder management, institutional frameworks)

By course completion, learners achieve ≥80% completion rate in leadership scenario games (team-building, crisis response, social responsibility) through ≥20 hours of self-directed exploration activities

By the end of the 6-month long-term course, learners apply all five core elements of a gamification design framework (e.g., MDA Framework: mechanics, dynamics, aesthetics, technology, goals) to plan a team collaboration simulation (organizational structure analysis, role distribution, communication strategies, institutional impact assessment) and submit a project meeting ≥2 of 3 evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, collaboration efficiency)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
